#Text=The host Golden State Warriors defeated the visiting Miami Heat , 97 - 80 , at Oracle Arena on Monday .
#Text=Golden State ( 8 - 3 ) won its fourth straight and has now won seven of its last eight games .
#Text=The Warriors entered the game averaging a league - best 121 points per game , but were held to just 97 points on Monday .
#Text=Golden State also dished out only 19 assists in the game .
#Text=Still , the team cruised easily to the victory .
#Text=All four members of the team 's `` big four '' scored in double figures , with Kevin Durant notching a team - high 21 points .
#Text=Fellow forward Draymond Green , meanwhile , was surprisingly efficient , scoring 18 points on 10 shot attempts .
#Text=The key to the victory for the Warriors wound up being defense , as Miami was held to just 35 percent shooting from the field while hitting only six three - pointers .
#Text=Miami ( 4 - 6 ) had its toughest offensive night of the season , scoring just 80 points on 35 percent shooting .
#Text=The Heat struggled throughout the game , as only two players scored more than ten points .
#Text=Star center Hassan Whiteside exacerbated the Heat 's struggles , shooting just 1 - of - 9 from the field for three points .
#Text=Miami also turned the ball over 20 times as a team , struggling to control the ball .
#Text=The lone bright spot was forward James Johnson , who scored a team - high 21 points to go with nine rebounds and six assists .
#Text=Golden State will host the Timberwolves on Wednesday , while the Heat will visit Phoenix .
